tasks.title: Security fixes + mahabharatha/git/ alerts
tasks.description: Fix 3 HIGH-severity security alerts: (1) Replace regex HTML stripping with html.escape() in pr_engine.py:63. (2) Change os.chmod 0o755 to 0o700 in history_engine.py:572,664. Also fix empty except blocks in history_engine.py:614,703 and bisect_engine.py:709. Remove unused globals: _SMALL_COMMIT_LINES in history_engine.py:34, _PATCH_TYPES in release_engine.py:41-47.

verification.command: python -m py_compile mahabharatha/git/pr_engine.py && python -m py_compile mahabharatha/git/history_engine.py && python -m py_compile mahabharatha/git/bisect_engine.py && python -m py_compile mahabharatha/git/release_engine.py && ruff check mahabharatha/git/pr_engine.py mahabharatha/git/history_engine.py mahabharatha/git/bisect_engine.py mahabharatha/git/release_engine.py

tasks.context:
## Security Rules (Python)
- Use html.escape() for user content, never regex stripping (OWASP A05, CWE-79)
- Temp files must use 0o700 permissions, not 0o755 (CWE-732)

## Spec Context
FR-001: Replace regex-based <script>/<iframe> stripping with html.escape(text, quote=True) in _sanitize_pr_body(). Import html module.
FR-002: Change os.chmod(script_path, 0o755) to os.chmod(script_path, 0o700) at two locations in history_engine.py.
Also: Add comments to empty except pass blocks. Remove unused _SMALL_COMMIT_LINES and _PATCH_TYPES globals.

## Empty Except Comments
- history_engine.py:614,703 — pass  # Best-effort temp file cleanup
- bisect_engine.py:709 — pass  # Best-effort git cleanup

tasks.title: Plan command WORKFLOW BOUNDARY fix
tasks.description: ALREADY COMPLETED. Track only. Fixed plan.md and plan.core.md: replaced overbroad 'MUST NEVER run implementation tools' with explicit PROHIBITED/REQUIRED/ALLOWED sections. Added .plan-complete sentinel file write in Phase 5.5. Files already modified on the fix/codeql-scanning-alerts branch.

verification.command: grep -q 'REQUIRED.*mandatory' mahabharatha/data/commands/plan.md && grep -q 'plan-complete' mahabharatha/data/commands/plan.core.md && echo PASS

tasks.context:
## Spec Context
FR-015/FR-016: Already implemented. The WORKFLOW BOUNDARY in plan.md and plan.core.md was overbroad — said 'MUST NEVER run implementation tools (Write, Edit, Bash)' which prevented creating requirements.md. Fixed by adding explicit PROHIBITED/REQUIRED/ALLOWED sections and .plan-complete sentinel.

- protocol_types.py _SENTINEL is imported by protocol_state.py — NOT unused.
- async_helpers.py: assign awaited results to _ to resolve ineffectual-statement alerts.

tasks.context:
## Spec Context
FR-003: Add comments to empty except pass blocks.
FR-004: Remove dead globals (RUNTIME_ONLY_TOOLS, _CONSECUTIVE_RUN_RE).

## Important: Logger Verification
Before removing a logger, grep the ENTIRE file for 'logger.' usage. CodeQL may flag the getLogger() call but the logger variable may be used in methods/functions lower in the file. Only remove if truly zero references.

verification.command: python -m pytest tests/unit/test_worker_commit.py tests/unit/test_small_modules.py tests/unit/test_main_entry.py tests/unit/test_worker_protocol.py tests/unit/test_schemas.py --timeout=60 -x -q 2>/dev/null; ruff check tests/fixtures/hook_samples/clean/test_file.py tests/fixtures/state_fixtures.py tests/fixtures/orchestrator_fixtures.py

tasks.context:
## Spec Context
FR-006: Remove unused imports in test fixtures.
FR-007: Rename unused timeout to _timeout in mock_launcher.
FR-008: Import-and-import-from in test files is often intentional (import for reload + from for symbols). Verify before changing.
FR-013: Remove if True: wrapper in test_main_entry.py. Remove redundant reassignments in test_worker_protocol.py.

## Important: Test Pattern Verification
In test files, `import module` + `from module import X` is a common pattern for:
- reload() testing
- Patching module-level state
Do NOT consolidate these without verifying the test doesn't use both forms.

tasks.title: Handle cyclic import false positives
tasks.description:
Address cyclic import alerts in 4 standalone files. These all use TYPE_CHECKING guards which prevent runtime cycles.

Files:
- mahabharatha/verify.py: check for TYPE_CHECKING import guard; if present, note for GitHub UI dismissal
- mahabharatha/verification_gates.py: same
- mahabharatha/level_coordinator.py: same
- mahabharatha/merge.py: same (confirmed TYPE_CHECKING on line 8,18)

For each file: verify the TYPE_CHECKING guard is in place. If any file is missing the guard, add it. Document all as false positives for GitHub UI dismissal.

Also check for any other fixable alerts in these files (unused imports, etc.) and fix them.

verification.command: python -m py_compile mahabharatha/verify.py && python -m py_compile mahabharatha/verification_gates.py && python -m py_compile mahabharatha/level_coordinator.py && python -m py_compile mahabharatha/merge.py && ruff check mahabharatha/verify.py mahabharatha/verification_gates.py mahabharatha/level_coordinator.py mahabharatha/merge.py

tasks.context:
## Spec Context
FR-009: These files have cyclic import alerts that are already mitigated by TYPE_CHECKING guards. Verify guards exist. If CodeQL still flags them, these are false positives for GitHub UI dismissal.

## TYPE_CHECKING Pattern
Correct pattern:
```python
from __future__ import annotations
from typing import TYPE_CHECKING
if TYPE_CHECKING:
    from mahabharatha.some_module import SomeType
```
This import never executes at runtime — only used by type checkers.

tasks.title: CHANGELOG update + full verification
tasks.description:
Update CHANGELOG.md under [Unreleased] with Fixed entries for all categories. Then run full verification suite.

CHANGELOG entries:
- Fixed 3 HIGH-severity CodeQL security alerts (HTML sanitization regex, overly permissive chmod)
- Fixed 33 empty except blocks with explanatory comments across codebase
- Removed 8 unused global variables and 7 unused imports
- Fixed redundant comparisons, self-assignments, and duplicate imports
- Fixed `/z:plan` WORKFLOW BOUNDARY bug preventing spec file generation
- Added `.plan-complete` sentinel mechanism to `/z:plan` handoff

Verification:
1. python -m pytest tests/ --timeout=120
2. python -m mahabharatha.validate_commands
3. ruff check mahabharatha/ tests/

verification.command: python -m pytest tests/ --timeout=120 -x -q && python -m mahabharatha.validate_commands && ruff check mahabharatha/ tests/

tasks.context:
## Spec Context
Update CHANGELOG.md under [Unreleased] > Fixed section. Use Keep a Changelog format.
Then run full verification: pytest, validate_commands, ruff check.
All must pass before marking this task complete.
